advance.aboutTitle: AFS Advanced is our way of concentrating our know-how and expertise into the most advanced designs, which is the essence and the future of AFS.

DirectSailing.As an:
As an AFS retailer for several years, Pascal (store manager)
                  initially chose the brand to promote Made in France in his
                  store.
DirectSailing.A wide:
A wide range of products ranging from catamarans, dinghies, and
                kayaks to SUPs, windsurf boards, and sailboats for private
                individuals. AFS distributor for several years.
DirectSailing.Local and:
Local and quality products" highlighted by his friend Thierry
                  Pen (co-founder Foil&Co and former sales director), all of
                  which gave rise to a commercial relationship between the brand
                  and the store.
DirectSailing.The Direct Sailing:
The Direct Sailing store has been in existence for over 20 years.
              Originally, the shop offered Hobie Cat catamarans, dinghies, and
              kayaks to equip clubs. Over time, they have followed the evolution
              of water sports and expanded their product ranges with SUP,
              windsurfing, land sailing, and wing, thus targeting private
              individuals.

gliss.p-1:
GlissAttitude has two stores steeped in history. One is located in Marseille city center and the other is in La Fos-Sur-Mer, on the beachfront. Run by enthusiasts, the company is a benchmark in terms of advice and water sports equipment.

"Always searching To guarantee the best for our customers, we do not hesitate to test our equipment in the water and on test benches. We record our comments on the equipment in our blog. "

guide.body-1:
Paddleboarding has established itself as a trendy outdoor sport,
              accessible to beginners and experts alike. We give you our
              professional opinion on the right stand-up paddle equipment to
              choose, the right prices, but also on spots, accessories and
              paddles!
guide.body-2:
What's in it for me?

Firstly, stand-up paddling is a super all-round water sport. Generally speaking, it not only stimulates your cardio, but also the muscles of your upper body, legs and abdominal muscles. It’s also the perfect way to improve your balance!

Secondly, the sup is very versatile. All-around paddling for adventure or pleasure, competitive racing, family use, surfing and SUP foiling: you can do it all with this discipline, in all conditions, and that’s what we love about it. More than just kayaking and canoeing, you can take advantage of all the best the sea and whitewater have to offer.
guide.body-3:
How to choose the right paddle?

Depending on my level of paddling

If you’re a beginner and you’ve never really taken part in water sports, the first thing to consider is not so much what you do, but your level. It’s important to select an easy board to discover this sport. It would be a shame to give up on stand-up paddling as soon as you’ve made your first runs with equipment that’s too small. Width is particularly important, as it determines your stability.

For intermediate riders, or those who already practice other board sports such as kitesurfing or windsurfing, you can already start to orientate yourself according to your chosen sport (surfing, cruising…), but the best thing is to go for boards that offer a minimum of versatility and comfort, so as not to get into difficulty.

For SUP experts, practice defines your needs, and we’ll explain in detail which board is perfect for each activity, so you can get the most out of it!
guide.body-4:
What size and shape for my stand-up paddle?

Generally speaking, these are the parameters we’ll use to define the SUP’s shape. Note that for the same level, the bigger you are, the more width and length you’ll need to make life easier.

The length

GThe longer your paddle, the more it “glides”. In other words, an oar stroke is more efficient. Length also reduces the “row” phenomenon. If your sup is very short, it will tend to swivel to the right if you paddle to the left. It’s great in surfing to be agile on the wave, but not so great in competition or over long distances when you want to change sides as little as possible…

The width

It provides comfort and stability. On the other hand, it will make you slower and require more effort to maintain speed. If you’re just starting out, it’s very important to have a consistent width so as not to get into trouble.

Thickness

More important for inflatable paddles, which must have spread skins to guarantee minimum rigidity. As you increase, you reduce the feeling of gliding as you move further away from the water. A greater thickness also reduces balance, as you find yourself tossed about like a cork on the water past the 5-inch mark.

Nose shape

Pointed noses are ideal for racing or for distance work, as they can easily split the wave. In surfing or for beginners, noses become rounder, losing glide but gaining grip on waves. On rigid paddles, you can also work on the shape of the bow, hull and deck to make them more resistant to chop, for example.

The shape of the tail

They come in a variety of forms, but to put it simply, the more the tail is pinched, the more you gain in manoeuvrability and lose in stability. The wider it is, the less manoeuvrable you are on the wave, but the better your start and the more stable you are.

Choice according to your practice

Combined, these can be used to create sup shapes that are more or less suited to your level of practice. Here are the main shapes found on the market, and found in all the brands on sale.

Paddles for beginners

What you need is an intermediate length for versatility (in the 9/11 foot range), a generous, round nose and tail, and above all, good width!

Allround paddles
guide.body-5:
It’s a compromise between the wave and the promenade. Relatively short, between 9 and 11 feet, it is often rather wide, with a round nose and a comfortable tail. Ideal if you’re just starting out, for family use or for an intermediate user who wants to do everything without getting in over your head.

Touring paddles
guide.body-6:
Longer than all-rounders, between 11 and 12 feet, with a more pointed nose, they often retain a little width. The longer length allows you to cover greater distances and row more efficiently, while keeping the shape affordable. They’re no longer relevant for waves, as they’re too long, but they’re still great at sea, even with a little chop. The larger models are ideal if you’re just starting out and don’t intend to surf with them. Note that there are even some for making doubles! These ranges are often available on rental sites, so don’t hesitate to consult our network of partners in France to find out more; the adventure may be worth the detour.

Paddles race

Long, often 12’6″ or more, they are also (very) slender, with pointed noses. If their balance is precarious, they are speed machines, especially on flat spots and long distances. For experienced users only.

Paddles for surfing
guide.headline: All about SUP
guide.p:
These are generally the shortest, under 10 feet, with a round
              nose. Very maneuverable, they have widths and tails specific to
              each model for different uses: a very pinched and thin tail for
              maximum agility to an almost rectangular tail for greater
              stability and power in soft waves.
guide.p-1:
One discipline that is becoming increasingly popular is sup
              foiling. We’ve put together a
guide.p-2: guide specifically for stand-up paddle foils
guide.p-5:
Essential SUP accessories

The leash

Safety first! As with most water sports, a leash is essential. It attaches to the rear of the tail, on the deck, and is worn on the ankle. We recommend the leash coiled – or telephone, which is the most common because it’s more comfortable.

The paddle

In downwind, the choice of starting bump is crucial. {" "} It’s your engine, and it’s essential that this equipment is good. There’s no point riding in a beautiful body if you have to push it by hand! So you’d better pay the price and enjoy the best of the discipline. Originally made of wood, today they’re either aluminum or composite (fiberglass and carbon). Aluminum requires maintenance, and although it’s very shock-resistant, it’s heavy and can’t be repaired if you bend the handle. This material is reserved for schools or very first prizes. We recommend either a mix of fiberglass and carbon, which can be good value for money, or 100% carbon if you use it regularly. And beware of removable oars: the more parts they have, the less rigid they are. If you’re planning to do some wave riding, downwind or distance work, go for a one-piece shaft, possibly with an adjustable olive, but avoid three-piece shafts.
guide.p-9:
Buying an inflatable or rigid paddle?

The advantages of hard surfaces in terms of feel, longevity and performance are absolutely indisputable, and very quickly outweigh the few disadvantages. If you want to use your equipment for something else, for very limited seasonal use, and if you want to prioritize quality (because inflatable prices often reach those of the hard stuff as soon as you want a minimum of performance, so it’s sometimes better to wait for the right promotion…), the inflatable may not be the solution, even if it’s common to read the opposite.

Paddle spots

The French spots are particularly varied, and it’s common for some of them to be cited as the best in the world!

Stroll

When it comes to hiking, as long as the conditions are right, the only choice is the landscape. From the Calanques in Marseille to the gorges of the Var, from the Dordogne to Lake Annecy and the Breton coastline, all you have to do is take your equipment with you to enjoy a whole new viewpoint in complete peace and quiet.

Breed

A wide range of race formats are available throughout France. The Tawara (in the Tarn region of France) and the full Dordogne run alongside races in the Atlantic Ocean, such as the Beach Race in Crozon, or The Race in Guadeloupe.

Supsurf

All the surf spots are waiting for you, from Brittany to the Basque Country. You can take off on the slightest ripple, so make the most of it.

Less common, downwind sailing is emerging in Brittany and the south of France, with foiling in full swing.

We told you: the French landscape is as rich as the discipline itself, and it’s this freedom that we love!

guide-downwind-2025.And avoid:
And avoid
              fatigue too quickly. This is both the most important and the most
              technical part of this type of discipline. Then, once you’ve got
              the hang of it, you can concentrate on the glide – in other words,
              a fluid glide that allows you to accelerate, refine your
              trajectories and make nice curves over the water.
guide-downwind-2025.And its clear:
And it’s
              clear that using your wing is much less tiring than rowing. So why
              not strap your paddle to your wing handles and don a waterproof
              backpack? Once you’re far enough out to sea, you can stow your
              wing in the bag, unhook the paddle and do the SUP foil downwind!
              And if you’ve overestimated yourself because it’s your first time,
              there’s always the option of freeflying back down. A word of
              advice: use a relatively large board (minimum 85-90 liters, so you
              can stand up comfortably on the water).
guide-downwind-2025.Because:
Because it’s important to stay well hydrated when you’re
                  sailing for a long time.
guide-downwind-2025.Choosing the: Choosing the right slope for SUP foil launch
guide-downwind-2025.Downwind:
Downwind sailing is the practice of sailing from point A to point
              B in the direction of the wind. In other words, sailing on the
              open sea and downwind, using the swell, currents and wind at your
              back. You can do this with a wingfoil or SUP foil.
guide-downwind-2025.Downwind sailing:
Downwind sailing is not a recent phenomenon, but it has been
              revolutionized by the arrival of the foil. Combined with a wing,
              parafoil or paddle, the foil allows the rider to generate the
              propulsive force needed to take off and let the elements carry him
              or her along. During downwind, the sensation of gliding is
              amplified… It’s simply incredible!
guide-downwind-2025.Efficient take-off:
Efficient take-off requires practice! Start on flat or slightly
                choppy water, always rowing on the same side and trying to keep
                as straight as possible, in the same trajectory.
guide-downwind-2025.Every rider:
Every rider
              should inform his family and friends of his outing (place and
              approximate time of departure and arrival + itinerary + number of
              people), and why not also notify the CROSS (Centre régional
              opérationnel de surveillance et de sauvetage). And don’t ever go
              out alone – at least two of you!
guide-downwind-2025.For beginners:
For beginners, we recommend a front wing between 1400 and 2000
              cm², depending on your size and the weather conditions. As you
              progress, and after you’ve completed several downwind runs, you’ll
              be able to move on to a more high-performance, glide-oriented foil
              with a higher aspect ratio. Like the Pure range from AFS, for
              example.
guide-downwind-2025.For downwind Stand:
For downwind Stand up paddle foiling, the ideal first experience
                is to have a fairly steady wind between 15 and 25 knots, blowing
                in the same direction as the swell.
guide-downwind-2025.For the foil:
For the foil mast, the recommended size is between 75 and 85 cm,
              which reduces drag in the water and optimizes take-off. For the
              fuselage, prefer a medium-length model, around 65cm, to ensure
              greater stability when you start out. The shorter the foil, the
              more responsive it will be, but the aim is to stay on the board as
              long as possible. Finally, the stab shouldn’t be too small either,
              to be comfortable in flight.
guide-downwind-2025.Generally:
Generally
              speaking, these boards measure between 7′ and 9′. This depends on
              the type of water you’re used to riding on. Their shape makes
              take-off quicker and easier than with a standard wingfoil board or
              a mid-length, which is a little less taut and wider. On the other
              hand, for a downwind wingfoil, these two types of boards are
              perfectly suited and even recommended.
guide-downwind-2025.If you:
If you want to learn how to downwind with a SUP foil, it’s best
                to choose a front foil with a large surface area to support and
                promote take-off.
guide-downwind-2025.In downwind: In downwind, the choice of starting bump is crucial.
guide-downwind-2025.In SUP:
In SUP foil (with an oar and without the wing), opt for a stiff,
                long and narrow board, specially designed for downwind.
guide-downwind-2025.It makes: It makes it easier to see from afar.
guide-downwind-2025.It protects:
It protects against knocks in the event of a fall, and helps
                  you float more easily when you fall.
guide-downwind-2025.Its a:
It’s a
              small wave or micro-clap that’s straighter than the others. Not
              always easy to visualize when you’re just starting out. Bumps
              often appear as small series of waves or swell trains, with a more
              pronounced thrust than the marine environment around you. Although
              short-lived, this push is quite powerful and is accompanied by a
              suction effect followed by a “push” lasting 2 to 3 seconds. To
              take advantage of the power of this famous “bump” to reach the
              speed needed to take off, you need to row continuously and
              explosively during this suction effect.
guide-downwind-2025.Its a marine:
It’s a marine radio that lets you communicate directly with
                  the shore or other people at sea.
guide-downwind-2025.Its undeniable: It’s undeniable protection for your head.
guide-downwind-2025.Safety: Safety is paramount in long-distance downwind sailing.
guide-downwind-2025.Safety equipment:
Safety equipment should not be neglected. It is highly recommended
              to take the following additional equipment:
guide-downwind-2025.The latter should:
The latter should not be too tight to promote glide and speed.
              With more technique, practice and pumping mastery, you’ll then be
              able to go out in lighter wind conditions.
guide-downwind-2025.This belt:
This belt includes a lifejacket containing a CO2 cartridge + a
                  distress flare.
guide-downwind-2025.This gives:
This gives you more power to lift your board out of the water. On
              the other hand, position yourself slightly sideways, in surf mode,
              and row on the side of your toes. This helps you to better control
              the inclination, direction and trim of your board, and thus to
              catch the swell more easily. Finally, accompany your rowing
              strokes with pumping: your legs push up and down on the board
              rhythmically and evenly, without sudden movements. This will help
              you generate speed.
guide-downwind-2025.title: All you need to know about downwind: endless gliding moments
guide-downwind-2025.To make:
To make a downwind accessible and start it, of course you have
                to go upwind!
guide-downwind-2025.Turn your: Turn your wingfoil session into a rowing downwind!
guide-downwind-2025.What: What equipment should you use for a downwind?
guide-downwind-2025.What are: What are the ideal conditions for downwind sailing?

home.subText: AFS’s mission is to offer the best-performing foils, boards and wings, while guaranteeing first-rate accessibility and stability. To ensure that all riders can practice their sport in complete safety, whatever the conditions and whatever their riding style (freeride, carving, downwind, surf foil, etc.). These products are designed and manufactured in Brittany, France, by Foil And Co. French manufacturing using the most advanced techniques to offer you the best quality!
home.video:
AFS’s mission is to offer the best-performing foils, boards and
            wings, while guaranteeing first-rate accessibility and stability. To
            ensure that all riders can practice their sport in complete safety,
            whatever the conditions and whatever their riding style (freeride,
            carving, downwind, surf foil, etc.). These products are designed and
            manufactured in Brittany, France, by Foil And Co. French
            manufacturing using the most advanced techniques to offer you the
            best quality!

madeInFrance.At foil and Co:
At foil and Co our most successful example is the reuse of
                prepreg carbon scrap. They are recovered to form the plates,
                i.e. the base of the foils. Therefore, there is no more than a
                3% loss on raw materials during the production cycle.
madeInFrance.At Foil & Co there:
At Foil & Co there is no loss of raw material. All carbon off-cuts
              are reused to be reintegrated into the production cycle.
madeInFrance.But we decided to:
But we decided to take it as an opportunity. Beyond the fact
                that local production considerably reduces the carbon footprint
                of our products and that we are proud to create jobs and
                know-how, there is another major advantage: producing in France
                allows us to reach a higher level of requirement concerning the
                quality of our products.
madeInFrance.choice made France: The choice of a “made in France” production has been a driving force in the construction of the company. At first glance, we often think of the constraints that this entails for a company: high production costs, need for employees, management, storage … etc..
madeInFrance.Designing:
Designing responsible products also means taking into account
                their manufacturing and production process.
madeInFrance.Foil and Co:
Foil and Co is a company specialized in the manufacture and sale
              of equipment for wing foil, surf foil, sup foil, windfoil. We are
              experts in the design and manufacture of composite products.
madeInFrance.Foil & Co:
Foil & Co has been in existence for 6 years now. We have always
              worked in the direction of ecology and sustainable development, in
              a serious and committed way.
madeInFrance.For us:
For us, it is all these commitments that will enable us to build
                tomorrow’s business world: committed to the environment and
                responsible.
madeInFrance.From the start: From the start, our ambition was to succeed in designing products that would last over time. Today we are able to say that our foils have an average life span of 10 years. As a comparison, the average life of an aluminum foil is 2 years
madeInFrance.In addition: In addition to its competitive advantages, such as its lightness, which make it the most efficient material for designing a foil, carbon is above all extremely strong and has an impressive rigidity.
madeInFrance.Indeed:
Indeed, our product lines are constantly tested (by our team
                members, our team of riders, by our customers). This proximity
                allows us to constantly improve our offer in a very short time.
madeInFrance.Indeed our product:
Indeed, our product lines are constantly tested (by our team
                members, our team of riders, by our customers). This proximity
                allows us to constantly improve our offer in a very short time.
madeInFrance.In our approach:
In our approach, we place the employee at the heart of the
                company’s processes to develop our internal know-how and to be
                as autonomous as possible. We have managed to design some of the
                machines used in the manufacture of the foils ourselves, such as
                the presses, which allows us to be more autonomous.
madeInFrance.It is through:
It is through our brand AFS, specialized in the field of foils,
              that we offer 100% carbon foils, manufactured from A to Z in our
              factory in Pencran, France.
madeInFrance.Our activity:
Our activity takes place in an eco-designed building, allowing us
              to be 90% autonomous in energy.
madeInFrance.Putting people: Putting people at the heart of our operations
madeInFrance.Since this year:
Since this year we propose a buy-back - reconditioning - resale
              offer for our foils. The creation and mastery of a fleet of
              second-hand equipment allows us to significantly extend the life
              of our foils.
madeInFrance.Sustainable:
Sustainable development is one of the founding pillars of Foil and
              Co: our ambition was to succeed in reindustrializing in France, by
              gathering and controlling our production from A to Z: from the
              design office to production and shipping. This has allowed us to
              limit our impact on the environment by creating short circuits,
              and to be in constant improvement on the performance of our
              products, all by using sustainable materials.
madeInFrance.The choice: The choice of carbon: an asset for the durability of foils
madeInFrance.The well-being:
The well-being of our employees is our top priority. In
              particular, we use prepreg carbon because it is much less volatile
              than conventional resins.
madeInFrance.This material:
This material is ideal for use in the nautical field. It is also
                very resistant to external aggressions (salt, sea, corrosion)
                and can be repaired and reconditioned very well, unlike
                aluminum.
madeInFrance.title: Foil & Co, a fundamentally responsible company
madeInFrance.We also promote:
We also promote existing local know-how that we develop through
                the training of new employees, in particular by encouraging
                apprenticeship and work-study contracts.
madeInFrance.We have:
We have privileged the use of a durable material, resistant to
              external aggressions and capable of being reworked and repaired,
              to maximize the life of our foils.
madeInFrance.We have established:
We have established our workshops in France to considerably reduce
              the carbon footprint of our products and to control their quality
              and performance on an ongoing basis.
madeInFrance.We make the:
We make the most of their know-how in the various core
                businesses within the company.
madeInFrance.We manufacture: We manufacture some of our own production machines.
madeInFrance.We settled in:
We settled in Pencran, in a rural area, in order to promote the
                development of the local employment basin, rather than in a
                large metropolis where the industrial zones are already
                saturated. Our workshops are installed in an eco-designed
                building, we are 90% self-sufficient in energy thanks to the
                installation of solar panels and we encourage carpooling between
                employees.
madeInFrance.Working: Working in short circuits: the choice of made in France.

Need-advice.Book a: Book a time slot to pick up your e-commerce order
Need-advice.Book a call: Book a call with an advisor
Need-advice.For this:
For this, we have several ways to talk to each other, choose
                  the one that suits you.
Need-advice.The well-being:
The well-being of our employees remains our main concern. In
                particular, we have closely studied the physical working
                conditions of the team members on the production line and have
                optimized and arranged each workstation in order to limit bad
                postures and repetitive gestures.
Need-advice.title: Need advice
Need-advice.While you: While you wait for our reply, feel free to read our various guides:
Need-advice.You want: You want to contact us — write to us, we will help you.

reconditioning.heading: Our range of reconditioned foils
reconditioning.heading_2:
We are proud to present our refurbished products, an initiative
              that reflects our commitment to the environment and our desire to
              provide you with products that are close to new condition, at a
              more affordable price and with the same high level of service.
reconditioning.sub:
With this conviction in mind, we have set up a reconditioning line
              in our Brittany factory to repair and refurbish all our products
              that can be reconditioned by our experts, whether it's a returned
              product, damaged packaging or purchased equipment.
reconditioning.title: reconditioning

support.in-addition:
In addition, we have prepared tutorial articles to guide you in
          resolving the most common issues on your own.

WILD → only one possible version DIAMOND → only one possible

support.need:
I need to repair my board, is it possible to know the color or RAL
              code?
support.need-please:
Please note, there may be slight differences between the color
                code and the actual appearance of the board depending on the
                techniques used in the workshop or factory. The codes provided
                are those that come closest to the final result.
support.our-repair: Our repair experts know how to restore your AFS equipment.
support.quicly: to quickly and easily resolve the issue,
support.repair-here:
Here you will find all the information you need about repair options
            for your product. Select the category you are interested in to find
            out about the repair options available.
support.these: These services only apply to AFS, AHD, and Sealion products.
support.title: AFS Support – Need Help?

We will take back your old AFS foil when you purchase a new one.

surfone.heading: AFS products are available in the
surfone.Passionate about nature: Passionate about nature, and windsurfing in particular, Laura has recently taken up windsurf-foil and wing foil to give you even better advice at Surfone. She’s an aficionado of stand-up paddling, preferably in the waves, with the occasional ballad.
surfone.sub_h: Surfone offers a wide range of products for all levels and types of practice, including AFS equipment
surfone.The sales staff: The sales staff are keen sailors who don't hesitate to get in the water to test all the products so they can give you the best advice!
surfone.The Surfone store was: The Surfone store was set up in 1978 in the seaside resort of Port Leucate on the Terres Catalanes, a mecca for board sports renowned for its Tramontane wind. The team welcomes you in a 400m2 space, offering a wide range of products for all levels and types of practice.

visit.precission: Precision down to the smallest detail.
visit.the-production: The production of foils and boards is a real challenge. It requires precision and expertise at every stage, from the design to the final assembly. Our factory is equipped with the latest technology to ensure the best quality and performance.

wind-foil-2023-guide.allround_paddles_sub: It’s a compromise between the wave and the promenade. Relatively short, between 9 and 11 feet, it is often rather wide, with a round nose and a comfortable tail. Ideal if you’re just starting out, for family use or for an intermediate user who wants to do everything without getting in over your head.
wind-foil-2023-guide.all_the_surf_p: All the surf spots are waiting for you, from Brittany to the Basque Country. You can take off on the slightest ripple, so make the most of it.
wind-foil-2023-guide.a_wide_range_p: A wide range of race formats are available throughout France. The Tawara (in the Tarn region of France) and the full Dordogne run alongside races in the Atlantic Ocean, such as the Beach Race in Crozon, or The Race in Guadeloupe.
wind-foil-2023-guide.buying_an_inflatable: Buying an inflatable or rigid paddle?
wind-foil-2023-guide.choice_according_sub: Combined, these can be used to create sup shapes that are more or less suited to your level of practice. Here are the main shapes found on the market, and found in all the brands on sale.
wind-foil-2023-guide.depending: Depending on my level of paddling
wind-foil-2023-guide.discipline_p:
One discipline that is becoming increasingly popular is sup
foiling. We’ve put together a
wind-foil-2023-guide.essential_sub: Safety first! As with most water sports, a leash is essential. It attaches to the rear of the tail, on the deck, and is worn on the ankle. We recommend the leash coiled – or telephone, which is the most common because it’s more comfortable.
wind-foil-2023-guide.firstly:
Firstly, stand-up paddling is a super all-round water sport.
              Generally speaking, it not only stimulates your cardio, but also
              the muscles of your upper body, legs and abdominal muscles. It’s
              also the perfect way to improve your balance!
wind-foil-2023-guide.for-intermediate:
For intermediate riders, or those who already practice other board
              sports such as kitesurfing or windsurfing, you can already start
              to orientate yourself according to your chosen sport (surfing,
              cruising…), but the best thing is to go for boards that offer a
              minimum of versatility and comfort, so as not to get into
              difficulty.
wind-foil-2023-guide.for-sup:
For SUP experts, practice defines your needs, and we’ll explain in
              detail which board is perfect for each activity, so you can get
              the most out of it!
wind-foil-2023-guide.generally-speaking: Generally speaking, these are the parameters we’ll use to define the SUP’s shape. Note that for the same level, the bigger you are, the more width and length you’ll need to make life easier.
wind-foil-2023-guide.gthe: GThe longer your paddle, the more it “glides”. In other words, an oar stroke is more efficient. Length also reduces the “row” phenomenon. If your sup is very short, it will tend to swivel to the right if you paddle to the left. It’s great in surfing to be agile on the wave, but not so great in competition or over long distances when you want to change sides as little as possible…
wind-foil-2023-guide.guide_specifically: guide specifically for stand-up paddle foils
wind-foil-2023-guide.how: How to choose the right paddle?
wind-foil-2023-guide.if-you: If you already practice a water sport like windsurfing, wing foiling, kite foiling or perhaps surf foiling, you’ve probably heard of wind foiling: a variant of windsurfing where the main objective is to glide over the water thanks to a foil, offering a sensation of flight.
wind-foil-2023-guide.if-you'r:
If you’re a beginner and you’ve never really taken part in water
              sports, the first thing to consider is not so much what you do,
              but your level. It’s important to select an easy board to discover
              this sport. It would be a shame to give up on stand-up paddling as
              soon as you’ve made your first runs with equipment that’s too
              small. Width is particularly important, as it determines your
              stability.
wind-foil-2023-guide.in_downwind_p: It’s your engine, and it’s essential that this equipment is good. There’s no point riding in a beautiful body if you have to push it by hand! So you’d better pay the price and enjoy the best of the discipline. Originally made of wood, today they’re either aluminum or composite (fiberglass and carbon). Aluminum requires maintenance, and although it’s very shock-resistant, it’s heavy and can’t be repaired if you bend the handle. This material is reserved for schools or very first prizes. We recommend either a mix of fiberglass and carbon, which can be good value for money, or 100% carbon if you use it regularly. And beware of removable oars: the more parts they have, the less rigid they are. If you’re planning to do some wave riding, downwind or distance work, go for a one-piece shaft, possibly with an adjustable olive, but avoid three-piece shafts.
wind-foil-2023-guide.in_downwind_p_s: In downwind, the choice of starting bump is crucial.
wind-foil-2023-guide.is-a:
is a less physical discipline than windsurfing, provided, of
              course, that you have mastered it to some degree.
wind-foil-2023-guide.it-provides: It provides comfort and stability. On the other hand, it will make you slower and require more effort to maintain speed. If you’re just starting out, it’s very important to have a consistent width so as not to get into trouble.
wind-foil-2023-guide.lesh_p: Safety first! As with most water sports, a leash is essential. It attaches to the rear of the tail, on the deck, and is worn on the ankle. We recommend the leash coiled – or telephone, which is the most common because it’s more comfortable.
wind-foil-2023-guide.less_common: Less common, downwind sailing is emerging in Brittany and the south of France, with foiling in full swing.
wind-foil-2023-guide.nose_sub: Pointed noses are ideal for racing or for distance work, as they can easily split the wave. In surfing or for beginners, noses become rounder, losing glide but gaining grip on waves. On rigid paddles, you can also work on the shape of the bow, hull and deck to make them more resistant to chop, for example.
wind-foil-2023-guide.paddles_for_surfing_sub: These are generally the shortest, under 10 feet, with a round nose. Very maneuverable, they have widths and tails specific to each model for different uses: a very pinched and thin tail for maximum agility to an almost rectangular tail for greater stability and power in soft waves.
wind-foil-2023-guide.paddles_race_sub: Long, often 12’6″ or more, they are also (very) slender, with pointed noses. If their balance is precarious, they are speed machines, especially on flat spots and long distances. For experienced users only.
wind-foil-2023-guide.paddles_sub: What you need is an intermediate length for versatility (in the 9/11 foot range), a generous, round nose and tail, and above all, good width!
wind-foil-2023-guide.secondly:
Secondly, the sup is very versatile. All-around paddling for
              adventure or pleasure, competitive racing, family use, surfing and
              SUP foiling: you can do it all with this discipline, in all
              conditions, and that’s what we love about it. More than just
              kayaking and canoeing, you can take advantage of all the best the
              sea and whitewater have to offer.
wind-foil-2023-guide.shape_sub: They come in a variety of forms, but to put it simply, the more the tail is pinched, the more you gain in manoeuvrability and lose in stability. The wider it is, the less manoeuvrable you are on the wave, but the better your start and the more stable you are.
wind-foil-2023-guide.the_advantages_p: The advantages of hard surfaces in terms of feel, longevity and performance are absolutely indisputable, and very quickly outweigh the few disadvantages. If you want to use your equipment for something else, for very limited seasonal use, and if you want to prioritize quality (because inflatable prices often reach those of the hard stuff as soon as you want a minimum of performance, so it’s sometimes better to wait for the right promotion…), the inflatable may not be the solution, even if it’s common to read the opposite.
wind-foil-2023-guide.the_french_spots_p: The French spots are particularly varied, and it’s common for some of them to be cited as the best in the world!
wind-foil-2023-guide.thickness_sub: More important for inflatable paddles, which must have spread skins to guarantee minimum rigidity. As you increase, you reduce the feeling of gliding as you move further away from the water. A greater thickness also reduces balance, as you find yourself tossed about like a cork on the water past the 5-inch mark.
wind-foil-2023-guide.touring_paddles_sub: Longer than all-rounders, between 11 and 12 feet, with a more pointed nose, they often retain a little width. The longer length allows you to cover greater distances and row more efficiently, while keeping the shape affordable. They’re no longer relevant for waves, as they’re too long, but they’re still great at sea, even with a little chop. The larger models are ideal if you’re just starting out and don’t intend to surf with them. Note that there are even some for making doubles! These ranges are often available on rental sites, so don’t hesitate to consult our network of partners in France to find out more; the adventure may be worth the detour.
wind-foil-2023-guide.We_told_you: We told you: the French landscape is as rich as the discipline itself, and it’s this freedom that we love!
wind-foil-2023-guide.what-size: What size and shape for my stand-up paddle?
wind-foil-2023-guide.when_it_comes: When it comes to hiking, as long as the conditions are right, the only choice is the landscape. From the Calanques in Marseille to the gorges of the Var, from the Dordogne to Lake Annecy and the Breton coastline, all you have to do is take your equipment with you to enjoy a whole new viewpoint in complete peace and quiet.
wind-foil-2023-guide.Windfoil:
Windfoil: a complete guide to getting started and progressing in
              the discipline

wing-foil-bordeaux-gliss-up.afs-products-are-available-at-the: AFS products are available at the
wing-foil-bordeaux-gliss-up.a young:
A young and dynamic team of multi-sport practitioners. Two
                  managers and their collaborators, all athletes to best advise
                  you in your equipment choices in the store.
wing-foil-bordeaux-gliss-up.everyone has:
Everyone has their own
              discipline, but we try to practice as many sports as possible to
              best advise customers, practicing this or that sport each weekend
              depending on conditions.
wing-foil-bordeaux-gliss-up.gliss-up-offers:
Gliss Up offers a wide choice of technical equipment from all
                brands, including AFS since 2016.
wing-foil-bordeaux-gliss-up.originally:
Originally, this store specialized in windsurfing, but the team
              has managed to follow trends to diversify and offer products that
              meet everyone's practices. From surfing to foiling, including
              electric mountain biking, there's something for everyone!
